The food is great and the service is excellent but what really makes the total experience is Stasha the belly dancer. She lights up the room and creates a a great atmosphere that is not to be equalled!
author: kristen k.

description: Decent food, pleasant, festive ambiance complete with belly dancing. Food is well-prepared but not mind-blowing. Very limited per-glass wines (only one red). Fun place to take a larger group for a lazy Friday dinner.
author: Peter B.

description: The atmosphere, belly dancer, and food were all great!  The service was good and staff was very friendly.  The lentil soup and the bastela starters were excellent.  I would go back on a special occasion.
author: LT B.

description: Great restaurant! Went there for the first time last Saturday, and I will definitely be back!  This place is so pleasantly different from other restaurants--you sit in very comfortable sofa-like seats, around small tables.  We ordered a set menu, which includes lentil soup (with amazing bread), bastela du chef (a pie-like thing with shredded chicken and raisins inside), an amazing salad with eggplant, cucumber and tomato toppings, and dessert which was a fried banana with some sweet biscuit.  I had the lamb with honey and almonds, my wife had the chicken with raisins.  Both entrees were amazing, and we left planning our next visit!  Definitely worth the price, and the ambiance is quite an experience!
author: George H.

description: Awesome!  They have everything down pat and included all the flourishes and little touches that made the evening feel special and authentic.  The Moroccan food was excellent, especially the lamb - so tender.  It's a beautiful, unique setting and the dancer was fantastic!  She looked like she was having a great time, along with all the birthday celebrants!
author: A. C.

description: I really thought this place would be great. The decoration is nice. But the food is really average and highly priced specially for the neighborhood they are located. The belly dancer was really friendly but wasnt much of a belly dancer. She was doing a good perfomance but that wasnt Belly dance. But it was enjoyable. The dance started really late around 9:30 PM and only was their for 20 min which I thought that it should have been longer. The menu are fixed and friend who is vegetarian and only can eat Vegetarian Cous Cous she was really dissapointed because the portion is small and wasnt that great. The deserts are big disspointment for all of us. The other dishes are ok. They should have option to order only one thing from the dish rather than making the menu fixed. Because not everyone wants the full course meal.
author: Dia A.

description: Everything about the place makes it great  .Great place for big groups.The service is really good, wonderful ambience .
author: Ricky A.

description: What an adventure.  My husband and I went there last Saturday just for casual dining and left the place feeling like we were just in Morocco.  The food was fantastic and they didn't rush you at all like most restaurants.  The belly dance was awesome...I'm already thinking about our next dinning experience there.  I highly recommend it.
author: Lyd H.

description: We went here for a birthday party. We brought fifteen people and each one was forced to order an entree, even the two small children. The entree was 30 bucks a pop for a normal entree, and the special was 40. Now with fifteen people at forty bucks a pop, not including drinks, they had better let someone share a meal. The belly dancer showed up late, it wasn't her fault, but she was white...no offense white chicks but you can't dance the same. NO small options, and we had to have things in a certain order, you couldn't have tea with your meal. I am all about cultural diversity, but you have to at least let people eat what then want when they want it especially if they are paying you. I worked in a french place that served an eight course meal, yea the wine was chosen to go with the meal, but if someone wanted another wine while they ate, they could have one...Overall this place is too damn expensive for the terrible service, rude people, and forcible feeding. Horrible for children and people with small  pocket books. The atmosphere is nice but definitely not worth it. The waitress was snobby as hell, and the guy could pour tea from really high up but that was not going to save this restaurant from my review. They wouldn't bring anyone forks even if we asked. Total bill was somewhere around seven hundred dollars, for that we all should have gotten a much better tasting meal than we got. Talk about money grubbers, at lest we only had to leave a fifteen percent tip (again I work in the restaurant industry and i usually tip 22%).
author: Unhappy C.

description: came here when i had a some out of town guests and it was a big hit! i recommend it if you're trying to impress your friends with a cultural experience. all of the food is served family style, and is consumed with your hands only. not a good place for germaphobes. the belly dancer makes for great entertainment, and my personal favorite part was when she tried to get my friend to kiss her brother, thinking they were a romantic couple. all of the food is amazing, and while it IS pricey, you will leave feeling as if you don't need to eat for another 3 days.
author: Mary Beth D.

description: one of the authentic morrocan restaurants in SF.  I made this comment based mostly on the interior design of the restaurant, the waiters'/waitresses' uniform, the BELLY DANCING, and the way they serve the food.  I've never been to any other morrocan restaurant, so I don't know if their style of serving the food (one dish at a time, next item you ordered won't come out unless you finish with your current plate) is authentic or just simply unique.  Anyways, the food was great, the belly dancing was beautiful, and the service was good.  Plan to spend at least 4 hours for dinner at the place if you come in a group due to the time it takes for all the dishes to come out, and be able to see belly dancing since she comes out like every half hour or 45 minutes.  The price here is not typical family dinner price at all.  Another down side is that they make each adult order one main course, which costs about $30 or $40 each.  But it is truly a place to take your relatives/friends from elsewhere when come visiting SF as a way to show the diverse ethnics in the city.
author: Karen C.
